Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: 000CST000
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Large room that was clean. Good service. Good breakfast included. Excellent location! Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not good to stay during construction work”
Reviews.Author: Mantles
Reviews.Content: Hotel took our money in full before arrival. When we arrived the fourth floor was being gutted. We were told the day we checked in that was the last day. Three days later when we checked out they were still going. Drills, hammers, sanding and all that good stuff. Small man on reception denied there was any noise, after much protests he moved us to another room but the noise was the same we just had a bigger room. Great location, but how this is a three star place is beyond me. Flooding bathroom, holes in the towels and linens, no remote for the 13" TV that was so high my wife couldn't reach the controls. (She's 5'4").

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't reccomend”
Reviews.Author: lynnierob
Reviews.Content: The single rooms are incredibly small. They can barely fit the bed. These rooms smell like the hallway which is disgusting, so they cover it with a lemon scented air freshener that does not quite cut it. There are only two bathrooms for half a floor and as you can imagine they are difficult to keep clean throughout the day. I would definitely not recommend the overpriced singles. I can't believe how much I paid for so little. It is easy to find and the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value-good service”
Reviews.Author: burcuw
Reviews.Content: People in the reception were extremely friendly..Breakfast was very nice..Rooms were very clean and comfortable..The small balcony made our trip even better. I will definitely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: XtremeTravel
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as an extreme last minute, literally booking over the phone on the way to the airport. As the price of this hotel was way cheaper than others, I was expecting the worst, but it was actually a very friendly and clean hotel, with the receptionist being of Pakistani origin if I'm not mistaken who was also very friendly. All by all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but would be nicer if there's a lift”
Reviews.Author: jacarandas
Reviews.Content: I was here on NYE 2011, and 1 Jan 2012. Given how everything in Venice is rather pricey, this place is fairly decently priced given its close proximity to the central station, and the occasion. The service staff were friendly. The breakfast offered is decent and very typically American. I had a room with shared bathroom on the 4th floor. The shared bathroom was really clean and big. However, the room I was given (first room on the left right by the stairs) could do with a lock change. It was easy to lock the door, but extremely difficult to open the door. A hard push to the door was needed each time you wanted to open the door. The hotel could do with a lift. I was solo backpacking. So, while climbing the flight of stairs up to the 4th level was a little tiring, it was fine for me. It would probably be more difficult for someone with luggages. One last note: The stariways smelled really bad, particularly the first level. I can't quite pinpoint where the smell was from, but it did smell a little like sewerage. Overall, it was an okay place to stay for two nights. But, I might think twice about staying beyond two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, no frills hotel near train station.”
Reviews.Author: Jean3650
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is located a few minutes walking from the train station. The hotel is located on a quiet street, so there were no issues with noise for sleeping. Hotel Description: The hotel lobby has been recently renovated. It has a modern look and feel. There is a small breakfast/cafÃ© area off the lobby. There is also a large area to store your bags if needed. Room Description: We booked a double room and, perhaps this was lost in translation, but we expected a large double/queen bed. Instead we got two very small single beds. The hotel was full, so we could not get another room. Not a big deal, but something to double-check when booking. The room itself was poor in quality. Small window with little natural light; not very clean (mysterious smudges on the walls); and very small (even by European standards). We did not have a bathroom in our room. There were several bathrooms on the floor. These varied in size and quality. One bathroom had a large bathtub, while another had a stand-up shower that was so small, it was difficult to change clothing. The bathrooms were kept very clean. Breakfast/meals: Breakfast was included in the room rate. The breakfast area was a bit of a mess. There were two staff members working the area, however, the tables were not cleared, and the food was not replenished very quickly. The staff members were seen texting on their phones and socializing with other staff. We were not greeted or acknowledged in any way. The food itself was very unremarkable consisting of yogurt, cereal, bread, coffee & juice. Service/staff: The front desk staff was very nice. Check-in and check-out was efficient. They were very accommodating with us leaving our bags for the day after our check-out (we had a late train). As mentioned above, the breakfast staff was not very good. Overall: Having read other Trip Advisor reviews of this place, I knew what I was getting intoâ€¦.an average hotel with good prices close to the train station. So, in shortâ€¦if you want a well-priced, no frills hotel in Venice that is close to the train station as a home-base for exploring Venice, this is your place. A one-night stay is fine, but if you are in Venice for multiple days, or want more creature comforts, there are many other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda D
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it was the only one with available rooms the weekend we went. I was pleasantly surprised. The room (a double) was quite large as compared to other European hotels. Clean, spacious, fully functioning bathroom, and excellent location, easy to find. Staff were friendly and helpful. I found the breakfast quite generous - full coffee bar, several different types of pastries, juice, cereals and yogurt. Noise from the streets and inside the hotel was slightly bothersome, but nothing that got in the way of a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Basic purpose serving B&B”
Reviews.Author: raptorama
Reviews.Content: Very basic hostelish accommodation. Nice old building, very venetion rooms with large windows and shutters. Shared bathrooms, old deco, no lift, no safe luggage storage (use station) However right in the middle of Venice, very easy to find, very close to the train station. Average breakfast. Dont expect luxury. Would prob not stay again unless poor.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: irini_pl
Reviews.Content: the good thing is that the hotel is in a very good location, near the train station, in a small quiet street and the only noise was the shouting of young teenagers going to school in the morning! The bad thing is that there is no isolation in this hotel, i think they do not know the meaning of this word! i was sitting in my bed and i was hearing peope talking in the next room! It is a poor and really tired hotel. when you enter at the reception you have the impression that you are going to pay for a 4star hotel but when you enter in the corridor this impression changes... Old furnitures and dirty stairs. As for the staff, i aksed directions how to get to a church and they sent me to the opposite direction!!! they were arrongant and they never smiled! The breakfast was a joke... it is better to have breakfast in a cafe near a canal than there... the breakfast area was too small, we have to wait for the coffee for quite long, and there is only bread and jam to eat... as for the juice it must be dated since 2000! i will not recommend this hotel for sure, try somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: JudyCecil
Reviews.Content: ( â€“ ) Floor was under construction and we had to step over construction works to get to our room which was on the 4th floor with no lift. ( â€“ ) Our room was tiny with a shared bathroom and an air conditioner which barely worked. We asked to upgrade to a room with a private bathroom (and no construction) and was denied. ( â€“ ) no wifi ( â€“ ) not sign-posted well ( + ) Location is good, near the train station ( + ) free (cold) breakfast This was the most expensive hotel we stayed in on our trip and also the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Massively improved - really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Brit_Hiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Alloggi Agli Artisti in August 2011. It was actually our second stay, having spent a few nights there in 2008. Since 2008, the hotel has had a massive overhaul - the reception and breakfast areas are new, and the rooms are much better equipped than before. The three of us shared a room which was huge and quite luxurious - fancy drapes and linen, with a TV and efficient air conditioning. The bathrooms and showers (shared) were also very good - hair driers and self cleaning toilet seats (of all things!) were available. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was excellent - it was great to stay somewhere where they made your coffee fresh for you, and could make plenty of different types! Overall, if you're looking for a relatively cheap place to stay in Venice, you could definitely do worse than stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Lubomir41
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just a few steps from main train station and in quiet street. The only noise is at the morning around 7 A.M from the bells of a church in neighborhood. The breakfast is monotonous but I didn't expect anzthing special - if you want to have english breakfats, try surroundings bars and tavernas. Actually, if you want just overnight in hotel and don't expect some special services (laundry, catering...) it has good value for you. The room was clean, big enough, with privat bathroom, staff was friendly and helpful. If you want to stay 3-4 nights in Venice, I could recommend you this hotel. Probably the only cons is missing lift.

Reviews.Title: “Giacomo is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: CKOTRAINERCOM
Reviews.Content: I really appreciate the care that the hotel and staff put into each detail. It will make your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, standard breakfast, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsT108
Reviews.Content: The staffs and location are great. The hotel is near the bus terminal (5 mins walk). However the hotel and breakfast are pretty basic. In summary, the hotel is are average and good for a quick break.

Reviews.Title: “Room does not looked like the one booked online and bad service”
Reviews.Author: lmllim
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for 2 nights stay. We were given a room with 2 single beds even though I booked and paid for a double room ensuite. They had the gall to tell us that we did not specify we wanted a double bed and that the toilet will be located externally. We had to carry our baggages up to the 3rd floor as there are no lifts in the hotel. When we open the hotel bedroom, we were shocked to see that we were given a room that is only half the size of a standard room with 2 single beds across each other, which looks like hostel type of room!! The room was small and dingy and the toilet was located a few doors away next to another bedroom! There were no towels or toiletries. I was very angry and disappointed since this was booked based on the positive reviews from Trip Advisor. It is really over rated! Luckily I had printed out the booking confirmation and showed them that I specifically booked a double room ensuite (which means toilet is located internally). I requested the dark man at the reception to change our room as we felt shortchanged and this was not the room that we booked (there are pictures of the room in the Venere website when you book and the room does not look like that). Anyway, he told me that was the last room they have and willing to give me free wi-fi as compensation. I kept complaining and finally he checked with his colleague to give me a room at another sister hotel, Albergo Marin (which is located 5mins across the bridge). We were given a triple room in the alternative hotel and this looks more like the standard room with attached bathroom. However, there is no air-cond in the room. There is only a fan. No lifts either but we got a room in 1st floor this time. Since it was only for 2 nights, we did not change to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: KJF345
Reviews.Content: Very close to the train station, no bridges to climb with your suitcases, this hotel has great location. On a quiet street, unassuming on the outside with well furnished room, but with easy access to vaporetto and the rest of Venice. As we had an early flight out, its close location to the bus station was also very useful for the airport bus service. Helpful desk staff who were multilingual. Downside, we got the handicapped room on the ground floor with a nice view of the air conditioning/water heating system (not sure which it was). However, the view was not a problem because we only slept there! Noise from the kitchen storage room which backed onto our room made sure we got up in time for breakfast on time, which again was not a real problem as we wanted to make the most of our time there. Location made up for all these issues. Breakfast was average but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and neat”
Reviews.Author: trrap
Reviews.Content: Close to the railway station, clean room and bathroom, good breakfast (no ham, though), perfect for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Reach Location”
Reviews.Author: cgandps
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very easily, it is close to the Ferrovia boat stop. We booked a room with a bathroom, as many rooms only offer shared bathroom. Our toilet leaked all over the floor when flushed, so we ended up using the shared bathroom anyway. It didn't bother us, as it was very clean. We stayed on the 3rd floor, and the hotel doesn't have a lift, I found the stairs quite difficult to walk up after a days walking around Venice. Our room was simple and clean. I found it difficult to operate the TV, and had to stand on a chair, as the remote control wasn't available, and the TV was almost at the ceiling. Breakfast is continental style (07:30-10:30), however I recommend going down to breakfast early, as items were not really replenished after 9.45am. Breakfast consisted of croissants, yoghurt, cereal, jam/marmalade/nutella, tea, fresh orange, hot chocolate. If you want a coffee the assistants are on hand to provide the coffee of your choice from the coffee machine. It's no frills, a good price and brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: djcarlos2001
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a surprise trip for my wife to Venice in October and found this hotel using the Easy Hotel website. The hotelâ€™s location was a big advantage along with the price. We booked a double room with en-suite. Upon arrival the reception staff were helpful, friendly and allowed us to check in slightly earlier than expected. We were also given a map of Venice which we found most helpful. Our room was on the 3rd floor, we only took hand baggage for our 3 night stay, but please beware, there is no lift. The staff appeared to use a pulley system to hoist linen between floors. The room was large with a front view of the quiet street below. The floor was creaky but overall comfortable. Our double room was made up of two single beds pushed together; however, this wasnâ€™t a major problem for us. Finally our bathroom was a little shabby and did require some maintenance. The shower cubicle leaked and there was a damp smell at times. To summarise, this hotel was good value, although we didnâ€™t spend much time there. The complementary breakfast was very good and we would certainly consider staying here if we return to Venice at a later date.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Sandy37088
Reviews.Content: Very noicy, rooms small, and dirty. The staff was not helpful or friendly. I cannot think of one thing positive to say about this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pigmy beds”
Reviews.Author: Ignimbrite
Reviews.Content: It is easy to reach from the airport coach and the train station, but once you are there you might have to lift your bags all the way to the top floor as there is no elevator. The walls were covered with dead mosquitoes, and if you are more than 170 cm, the bed might be too short for you, which makes it harder to have a good sleep. Internet is outrageously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: AnuP2D
Reviews.Content: Fairly close to railway station and can be reached easily. The rooms were reasonably large and clean. However, walls were exceedingly thin and we could hear clearly folks in neighbouring rooms through the night! The service was average as well with barely anything to remember about. The breakfast was decent. But there was no elevator and our room was in the 3rd floor - making it a nightmare to lug our luggage upstairs. Fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't check in...you will regret it!”
Reviews.Author: JANDA4E
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We encountered poor customer service, bugs, and the air conditioning (that we paid for!) never worked or was faulty for the three long nights we stayed there. Being reasonable and well educated people, my husband and I asked for a different room with working air and our needs were never met. Also , there were several power failures and a water main break on our floor. We were restless to say the least when we left. Please, stay somewhere else and save your money!

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Floor = Seventh Level of Hell”
Reviews.Author: barbiebabe1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 3 nights. The staff - with the exception of one guy who was somewhat helpful and at least recommended some good places to eat - was incompetent to say the least. On our third night, my husband and another guest had to help the ONLY person working in the hotel with the electricity breaker boxes. Out of the three nights we stayed there, the electricity went out twice. There was a water main leak, and our room, which was a decent size and relatively nice to look at, was never cleaned. Plus, the air conditioning NEVER worked, despite being told repeatedly it was being fixed or would be fixed. This was also during the hottest summers in Venice in recent memory (according to locals). We were forced to sleep with all windows open - which would be fine if not for the gale-force winds during summer thunderstorms. Beware of the Bates Motel. No manager - or "responsible" - is ever present. We were not offered any compensation or even a different room. Beyond all of those disasters, we were on the top level of the hotel, the fourth floor, with no elevator. And no staff to help carry your bags up the five flights of stairs. It is a beautiful hotel when you check inâ€¦but it gets very scary the longer you stay. I would never want anyone to have the horrible experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but without elevator!”
Reviews.Author: mayrametal
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The major problem was that they gave us 3 rooms in the 4th floor and there was no elevator. With lots of luggages it is really hard. Breakfast was ok, very limited, though. City map is available at the reception. Very good located in a quiet street and very close to the train and bus station. Surrounded by restaurants. Rooms were big but air conditioning in 2 of the rooms was not working properly.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good rooms excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: claudiagoncalo
Reviews.Content: in veneza you would like to left your bags as soon as you arrive there,so this is great,very easy to find.They keep your bags before and after check in/out.The breakfast is great,all the hotel is very clean,the problem is wifi that you have to pay and also the remote for the TV. If they tell you everything during the check in it would be great,we were walk inside the hotel just to figure how it works the WIFI or the TV.The staff at breakfast was great but at the check in it was a lit bit "fast"..

Reviews.Title: “Accordions and Mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: Esthersnippe
Reviews.Content: Pro: Opening up the balcony doors in the rain and listening to men play the guitars and accordions in the next balcony over. Location was also prime. Cons: EATEN ALIVE BY MOSQUITOS. No joke. If you are prone to getting bitten or do not like bugs avoid with a 10ft pole. Also, the room was not very clean. Over all, good price, but could have found something similar that was cleaner and with out the bugs.

Reviews.Title: “An almost perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Suissegirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. So close to the train station and right on the main island in Venice. It was clean and the staff were great. They gave us plenty of information and were willing to help us with whatever we needed. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful. The rooms were good, but tiny. Thankfully we weren't in them long, but they were very clean. The best thing about it was the location and the price. A great place for a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gribochka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. We paid 60 euro per night per room with private bathroom, balcony with good view! Everyday the towels were changed and the linen as well. Moreover, the breakfast was included. We woke up with the smell of just baked croissants:)) Great location for the great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Terrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mlwtravel
Reviews.Content: Out of two months of travel in Europe this was by far the worst hotel we stayed in. The location is excellent but everything else was terrible. The staff was not helpful at all. We did not get clean towels once during our 4 day stay even when we asked for them. We barely convinced them to give us a new roll of toilet paper half way through our stay. Do not stay here. There are plenty of other options within the price range and with great locations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Mosquito??”
Reviews.Author: Baggio925
Reviews.Content: It is true that it is in a very convenience location (2 minutes from the Train station Santa Lucia), however, no other reason for choosing this hotel. When I arrived the hotel at 12:30pm, the receptionist said the room will not be ready until 2:00pm. After I entered the room, I got into the toilet. What the hell??? It seems like a hospital toilet.....after I changed my clothes...I could find there were so many mosquito dead-body on the wall.....a minute later, I saw few mosquito flying in front of me! The towels were dirty... breadfast?nothing worth to talk about!! Though the price is marginally acceptable, I won't choose it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: rthomas34
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Artisti. The location is great. Especially if coming by train or bus. Located just of the Grand Canal and you are about 25 minutes away from San Marco Plaza by foot. We were greeted warmly and immediately squared away with our room. It was small but it served our needs. The beds were two singles pushed together but the sheets and room were clean. Being here in the winter season was a definite boon in one regard, less mosquitoes. I'm not saying they weren't a problem, but they are much less during these cooler months. I must have killed close to 100 of the little buggers during our 8 days of staying at the hotel. I still have the bite marks from the little blood suckers who got me while I slept. To be fair, this is a problem for the majority of Venice. I'm just glad that this was during the off-season for the little varmints! The bathrooms are community but there were three on our side of the floor (second). They were clean and always maintained. Not really a problem. The breakfast is good for the coffee and that is about it. The location and price of this hotel makes it well worth it. The staff was friendly and even helped us find a restaurant by calling it for us and getting directions. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lousy Room”
Reviews.Author: YanksAbroad
Reviews.Content: If this place charged a bit more and put the money into maintenance, it would be a fine place to sleep. However, the mattress was so soft and lumpy I had a backache the whole next day; the shower had minimal water pressure (and we were on the first floor); the floor was grimy, and there was a bit of an odor that the air freshener in the room couldn't defeat. They have free Wi-Fi, but you have to go into the lobby to get any reception. Breakfast was over-boiled coffee in an urn, and a limited supply of croissants and floury-white rolls. Surprisingly quiet and safe for a place behind a train station, but little more than a hostel in quality.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice for Venice”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller141
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, right near the train station. It's a little further from the sights though. Our room was clean and we slept well each night. It wasn't too loud and our beds were really comfortable. Front desk staff were friendly and spoke English. The breakfast was good (cereal, yogurt, bread rolls, brioche, juice, coffee, etc). Our only problem was the shower (down the hall) - one of them was 'out of order' and the other kept flooding. However, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good but rooms were dirty”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Trave1er
Reviews.Content: If you're staying only 1 to 2 nights and want to budget yourself, then this was a great hotel to be at, otherwise spend a little extra and stay somewhere else. The only 2 things this hotel had going for it was it's location and the cost. The room are very small and the room was not very clean - the bathroom always had that moist wet feeling around it (more than most places in Venice) The water had to be run for 10 minutes before the hot water would come on. It was one of the few places that after you showered, you still didn't feel clean.

Reviews.Title: “cheap for venice but ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel1987
Reviews.Content: the hotels in venice can be rather pricey so this is a budget hotel but perfect for what we are after. its right next to the train station a bit of a hike from the square though but still in walking distance. it surrounded by lots of shops and restaurant. the hotel itself was fine we had a private bathroom, even though very small, would rather have opted for this than the shared bathroom. the hotel was very clean and looked after and we had maid service everyday. the only downside was the noise of the hotel. very thin walls! some nights i could hear someone walking round upsstairs for what felt like a eternity. however venice is amazing i dont think it really matters where you stay in the mainland of venice you will want to spend very litle time in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed picture”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelBerlin
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a good location very close to train station (but very quiet). Room was reasonably priced for Venice (although expensive compared to many other cities). Shared showers had only now and then hot water. Breakfast included was acceptable but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing going for this hotel is its location”
Reviews.Author: ADYJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Alloggi Agli Artisti and yes, it was literally around the corner of the Venice Train station, which was great but that's where the positives ended. When we arrived at approx 6pm we were told that there'd been a 'mix-up' with our booking and we'd have to spend the night in 'Room 200' as well as share a bathroom with other guests on the floor and they'd give a both of wine as an apology. 'Room 200' turned out to be the sze of two broom closets, with two single, wonky beds at opposite sides of the 'room' and a tiny window above. With us and our suitcases inside, there was hardly any room to turn around! Next morning we waited over 2 hrs to get a chance to get to the bathroom and when we did, there was no hot water! We thought it had something to do witht he shower being communal and us not getting there first but when we demanded to be moved to a proper room as per our booking, we were dismayed to find out the water situation would persist - when we complained we were told to leave the water to run for a while before getting in - YEAH RIGHT! When I complained again after alternating bursts of a tepid and COLD water shower, I was told that I should have called reception first so they could 'check with their technician' and also that I should 'write to the manager'. All we could deduce from this is that there must have been a 'shower hour' (of which we weren't being told) and if you missed it - sorry for you! The breakfast was pitiful for the price we paid - only 1 croissant per person was handed out by the unfriendly kitchen/cleaning staff (except for 1 lady who could smile), two cereals with yogurts, jam, nutella, cocktail breadrolls, coffee and fruit juice. Their stinginess or rationing of guests was so blatantly obvious - they'd keep a heap of croissants in the back (not refill the breadtin) and each guest would have to ask for their portion. We also got the impression that because they had a 'fancy' coffee machine and cuppacinos could be ordered, this made up for the measly breakfast! TO top it all off, the cleaning staff didn't bother to greet or smile and by the 4th day it was obvious that they'd done the bare minimum to clean our room. I would definitely not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value base in Venice”
Reviews.Author: EdenLily
Reviews.Content: If you aren't lucky enough to have booked a Venice hotel for one cent (see the July 2009 online error honoured by Crowne Plaza hotel), then Alloggi Agli Artisti is the perfect bargain stay. Rooms, service and breakfast are all basic - you're not paying for more and you have all Venice to play in - but the hotel's clean, the staff helpful, and the air conditioning works. My one niggle is that WiFi is charged: in a city where simply standing still seems to drain your wallet, free internet access would be welcome. As previous reviewers have noted, there is no lift, so this isn't the place to stay if you have mobility problems or are travelling with heavy trunks. The hotel recently bought the adjoining building - the breakfast room is there - which is being done up in a sparkling deco style. It will be interesting if in time this look takes over the currently more traditional main building. Contrary to some other comments, this hotel is very easy to find, even in Venice's maze: it's towards the end of a lane almost directly opposite the Ponti degli Scalzi. If you're arriving by train, the hotel's just a few steps away from the station (and just as close to Lines 1 & 2 vaparetto stops). If you're flying in to Marco Polo airport, then take the bus, which drops you 20 minutes later in Piazzale Roma. It might be a less spectacular arrival than taking the water bus from the airport, but itâ€™s some â‚¬7 cheaper and Agli Artisti is just 5 -10 minutesâ€™ walk from the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, charm and location”
Reviews.Author: Smacka51
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel on-line for one night being the night following our arrival in Venice after flights from Australia totalling 24 hours. The following day we were embarking upon a Mediterranean Cruise and the the chief criterion was accessibility to Piazzale Roma from which Costa Cruises operates a shuffle bus to the dockside. the location also has the considrerable advantage of being close to the Santa Lucia Train Station and also the Vaporetto and Alilaguna water buses, the latter we used to travel from the airport. Transporting luggage long distances on foot is not recommended in Venice owing to the narrow, often crowded streets and arched bridges. The Hotel proved easy to locate despite being down a narrow street, (we would call it more of a lane) And appeared to be three buildings joined together. The desk staff were informative and helpful and spoke good Engish as our Italian is limited to a few words. (our experience indicated that most of th hotels customers were English speakers. The room was on the second floor and like most venice hotels there is no elevator but the staircase is wide and we had no trouble getting our bags up to the room. While the hotel is located in a very old building, the room we were in was completely renovated and included a small but modern bathroom. The room was light and airy with a charming balcony. The Hotel is situated close to many restaurants so we did not need to venture far to go out to eat. The comact size of Venice means that one could stay in this Hotel and easily access all of teh attrations on foot or via the vaporetto services. The Hotel is obviously still undergoing development which meant that breakfast room was fairly busy when we went down for breakfast but we managed to get a table that had just been vacated. The breakfast was typically continental but totally adequate for our tastes. There are a few must-sees within a short distance notably the old Jewish Ghetto which we explored during the hours we had at our disposal before departing for the dock. The Hotel had no problem storing our luggage during this time. We would recommend this Hotel, particularly for travellers taking a cruise or a train. We would have happily stayed another couple of days there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Smugangel
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, easy to find and pleasant reception staff. Had to pay 10 euro deposit for tv remote control but no problem getting this back at the end of our stay. Breakfast very basic - just a couple of cereals, croissants, yoghurts, small bread rolls and jam/spread, would have been nice to have meats and cheeses. Room adequate and clean with AC. Shower a bit tempermental but worked fine. Bedding and towels changed daily but had to leave towels on the floor or they wouldn't get changed.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, good value, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: charlesven
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel and flight through Easyjet. Nervous about reviews of hotel, but we found it very convenient, clean, friendly, and facilities were as booked: en-suite toilet and shower, phone, TV, air-conditioning. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was simple but more than adequate. Close to rail and bus terminal. Handy for vaporetti, but also everything within hearty walking distance. Nearest cafes inexpensive, and 10 minutes walk from Supermarket for picnic fare! Quiet park just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: diejam
Reviews.Content: we were on the 2nd floor, in a private bedroom with separate showers. the room was good, basic, bed and tv. bathroom almost outside door and we never saw anyone. had no problems with showering system. reception was nice, the guy was very proud that they were renovating. didn't like the idea that they didnt have lockers or a private room to put luggage for the day. everyone just put it downstairs where anyone could easily take your stuff. but i had breakables and asked reception if they could have that behind the counter and they were happy to. didn't like the bell going off or the people walking down the mainstreet. there weren't many people but it was loud. if you dont sleep in then this isn't a problem. breakfast was nice and basic. staff busy too so i took some nutella packs upstairs

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms are scary..”
Reviews.Author: dks61885
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel because it is very close to the train station - and it is, which made coming to and leaving Venice stress free. We got there early and the room was not ready so the manager at the front desk said he would hold our bags for us, but if there were any valuables in our bags to keep them on us because they can't be held responsible for any bags. Needless to say we did not leave our bags at all and got a quick bite to eat down the street. When we came back our room was ready. There was no elevator, and no staff there to help us with our bags... We dealt. We had a king sized bed in our room, so that made it very difficult to move around the room. The bed was very uncomfortable and the walls were paper thin so you can hear EVERYTHING going on in the surrounding rooms and in the streets. The cleanliness of the rooms was absolutely terrible. We were there for three nights and when we first checked in we noticed that there was a noticeable amount hair on the floor (in the bathroom) and stuffed in the draws of the night table there was a bag of bread (half eaten), peanut butter, and dirty tissues. Out of the three nights, our room only got cleaned once. The showers were also terrible. Ours had many problems. One minute the water would be coming out - the next it would barely be dripping out. The hot water did not work at all and when we brought this up to the person at the front desk they basically said that everyone was having these problems and there was nothing they could do about it. If you like a nice hot shower after a long day of sight seeing - don't expect to take one here.. The bathroom floor would also be flooded after a 5 minute shower. I would not come back to this hotel. It was moderately priced, and close to the train station, but it was not worth it considering they don't clean the rooms or have working showers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zynn
Reviews.Content: - The location of the hostel is just perfect. It's so close to the main train station and close to boat transfer as well. - The rooms are clean and pretty. - The staffs at the reception are quite helpful. - The atmosphere of the hostel is very good. - The only down side: The hostel is near to a church and the bell ring at 6.30am every morning and interrupts our sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Noisest hotel I've EVER stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rkEuroTrip09
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here unless you want to party until all hours of the night, because that is all you can hear from the street and the rooms next door. Stayed in a room with a bathroom down the hall and the bathrooms were constantly soaking wet b/c they only had half a shower door on the full shower with the shower head in the middle of the long wall and the water couldn't possibly stay in the tub. Bed was OK, room decent. Floor was dirty, but that was the norm for the places we stayed (except the 2 stars) for our entire trrip. Good location to the train station, but you don't hear the train--just everyone around you.

Reviews.Title: “Free slippers”
Reviews.Author: Wols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Alloggi Agli Artisti for 3 to 4 nights and found the front of hotel staff to be very helpful and welcoming, a free map of Venice is provided at the front desk and boat (not Gondola!) excursions etc can be booked there too. We had a lovely balcony overlooking the front of the hotel which is situated in what felt a safe and quiet off-road (with 2-3 discreet restaurants and other hotels), just around the corner from the train station (very convenient), the room was large but due to a few tiny gaps in the window frames it meant lots of mosquitoes kept buzzing in - there were even one or two squished ones on the walls/ pictures from the previous occupants! The breakfast room is small and the breakfast adequate, yoghurts, fruit and rolls etc, on our last day we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel long after we checked out which was great, again the front of hotel staff were very accommodating. We had a gondola ride more 'central' in Venice away from the train station and bustle - the gondola men in the busiest locations were charging a much higher fee for a ride and we were able to find a much more reasonable price in more central Venice in a less packed area. I would recommend this hotel for the location - and the free paper slippers!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, dirty bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: chamdo
Reviews.Content: Considering how expensive other Venice hotels are, this was decent value for the money. It's in a great location, just around the corner from the train station. The rooms were a little small and didn't appear to have any form of air conditioning, which could be a problem in the summer because leaving the window cracked open the first night netted us lots of mosquito bites. The bathrooms were disgusting. I didn't see any rooms with en-suite bathrooms, and the common ones had drainage problems and were covered in water and hair every time we used them. This may be mainly because of inconsiderate guests, though. The walls are also pretty thin - it wasn't a problem the first couple of nights, but when some noisy people checked in, it was hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: mand77
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay in this hotel and could not ask for anything more for the price. Room as clean and bright and everything you need for a city break. Only small thing was traveladaptor would not fit in plugs but did have hairdryer in bathroom. Breakfast was fine too and a good start to the day, selection of yoghurt, bread and croissants, with fruit juices and cappuccinos, though breakfast room was a little crowded at times. The location was great, 5 mins from bus station and 2 from train station, made it east to find after bus from airport and easy to get back to when lost in the maze of Venice's streets. Can walk anywhere within max 30 mins which is best way to travel in Venice. Nice location for cheaper meals on evening and cheaper shops too, though food is generally not of a brilliant standard in Venice. All in all would definitely return to this hotel or recommend to a friend visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and so quite”
Reviews.Author: chudy
Reviews.Content: Is a little lovely hotel very close to the station. With a very nice room in a quite floor, we enjoined to a marvelous stance in Venice...the service people was correct, maybe the breakfast a bit limited...but the rest was alright. If we need return to Venice, sure we turn this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: santimo90
Reviews.Content: The location is great! Just about 5 mins from the train station, we had no problems finding it at all!!! Just remember to go left as soon as you get out of the train station and it's the first small street ( or "calle") after the 1st cafe. I saw all those other people dragging their luggages around very crowded streets and vaporettos and I realized then that in Venice, one of the best pieces of advice I can give is that it's best to get a hotel near the train station as much as possible. The front desk people we talked to were very helpful actually and even called a taxi for us since we had to get to the airport at 4:00 in the morning. We were gonna just walk out to Piazzale Roma and hope to flag a taxi down but the clerk said "oh no there won't be any out there, let me call one for you" and were glad he did because it was completely deserted of taxis at that time. All the clerks we talked to spoke very good english and were very friendly. The room itself was nice and the size not too bad. The bathoom was clean and the towels were soft and felt like real towels (those who've stayed in various hotels in Italy understand what I mean). We had our own private bathroom, unlike what other people mentioned about sharing bathroms. I guess some rooms have them and some don't. The hotel is near a vaporetti stop as well so transportation is not a problem. The only problem that we had with the hotel is that THERE ARE NO ELEVEATORS! We were staying on the top floor (fourth floor) and our luggage was not light. I managed to carry our bags up but there were some elderly ladies that had to carry bags up 3 flights of stairs so keep that in mind before you book. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved venice”
Reviews.Author: roseb59
Reviews.Content: ok room right next to the reception area very noisey , Good breakfast but dont ask for a second cup of tea thats a no go. Close to rail and some realy good restraunts.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: MontrealShopper
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 13, with 4 rooms. Clean linens and bathrooms. Shower interesting (water temperature varied wildly). Breakfast good continental. Great location, close to train station and vaporettos. Nothing fancy, but who spends time in their room in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RomanWG
Reviews.Content: Found the service to be incredibly rude from the beginning, when they were going to charge me an extra night for a mistake in booking, till the end, when a water leak erupted in the hall. The facilities were actually decent, but the people who worked there were rude and unhelpful (one receptionaist in particular). I anjooyed my stay at Agli Artisti less than I've enjoyed any hotel stay ever. An awful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler52
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, a double and a triple at this location. I was wary of the 2 star rating, but, the stay was great. Beds were comfortable, room was clean, with adequate amenities. Bathrooms functioned well. If you are not familiar with Venice, you will miss the "calle" as it's really nothing larger than an alleyway. Great location to the Train station and Ferrovia vaporetto stop. As numerous reviews have stated, beware that there is no lift at this location. We stayed on the second floor (third floor for the USA), and it was high enough. Breakfast buffet was small, but coffee was freshly made to order (espresso, machiatto, etc.). A great stay for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Venice S. Lucia Station”
Reviews.Author: gln126
Reviews.Content: It's a five minutes walk from Venice S. Lucia Station to the hotel. You may leave your bag if you arrive early. The hotel offers free map. Room 304 was small but adaquate and had a tiny balcony. The A/C was really strong. There was a tiny sink in the room but you have to share the bathrooms. There were three bathrooms with a shower, toilet, sink and bidet on the third floor. The partition for the bathtub was a stationed piece of plastic that covered 1/3 of the bathtub only. They offered simple breakfast with croissants, yogurt, orange juice and coffee. The Shanghai Restaurant next to the hotel offered ridiculously small portion. Maybe that was the European portion. We were not used to this portion. We spent 22 euros (U.S $33) for a lunch and left the restaurant feeling under fed and overcharged.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones”
Reviews.Author: amnornes
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, I'll give them that. And it's near the station, which is nice if you've got luggage to port around. They also seem to be tryingâ€”they even have shampoo, etc emblazoned with their logo. But don't expect much besides a place to sleep. They refused to let me book by phone, probably because they could charge a surcharge for web reservations (why else?). The website I booked from said they have wireless, which was important for me because I needed to work. But it turned out they charged something like 11 Euros for it (more than 4 and 5 star hotels I've stayed at!). I was told there was a bathroom (and no shower) in my room, but there was none. The shower on the 4th floor doesn't work (and the bathtub is now a planter) so we had to use the 3rd floor shower; it is literally, amazingly just large enough to stand in with the curtain plastered to one side of your body and water pouring out onto the floor. The breakfast seems to be an extra for Venice, but it's nothing special. Bare bones. Hostile front desk. But on the cheap end, close to the station, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Annex was another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet75
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in an Annex room with bathroom of the Alloggi Agli Artisti for 3 nights. On arriving at the hotel, we were told that the Annex was actually another hotel 5 minutes walk away. The Hotel we actually stayed in was great. The room was clean and was ideal for a short stay. The breakfast (which was included) was great value and it was within easy walking distance of the train and bus stations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: LacLondon
Reviews.Content: So its no 4 or 5 star hotel, or even a 3? But this is venice and hotels cost mega bucks! But luckily for me Alloggi Agli Artisti didnt! We had room 306 with a balcony and it was the largest room according to the fire escape plan on that level, aircon and a sink and a couch were in the room and the wooden floors and pictures were a nice touch. We had 2 bathrooms with showers directly across the hall, one had some plumbing issues but wasnt a problem. The hotel in the hallways had a bit of a stench but once in the room it was fine. Our room was actually great, airy and light. Its right by the Grand Canal and train station and its very easy to get to from Marco Polo airport, just get the bus to P. Roma bus terminal and its a 5 mins walk from there. Its nice to be away from the hords of people off the main pathway also. I really recommend it for budget travellers. Breaky was ok, nothing special at all but the coffee was great! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Charmless place near train station in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SalientWitness
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in a room on the top (fourth) floor of this hotel because just about everywhere else I phoned in Venice that may have had a room for cheaper than â‚¬100 was full up. In Venice, paying â‚¬75 for a room with a double bed, with shared bathroom, on top (fourth) floor with no lift, located close to the train station, it was exactly what I was expecting. Kind of seedy in appearance, but actually clean, with rickety furniture and single-glazed windows. Breakfast was in a poky little space with small tables crammed very closely together: my guess is it must be awfully hot there in summer. At least the bedroom was spacious and the reception desk staff were reasonably polite and spoke good English. In general, though, it is a rather charmless place. I wouldn't come back here unless nowhere else was available and/or I needed to be within five minutes on foot from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: two_golfers
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very close to train station. Great location for not having to haul luggage all over Venice like we saw others doing. There is a potential for water damage as when we got there they said that our room was ready, but it had rained the 2 nights before and were problems with others. NO elevator and it's a long walk up with bags. They only give you 2 bath towels and won't have any more until the next day when the laundry comes back. No face or hand towels given. Very small shower. The air cond. was not working while we were there, but kept the windows open. No screen so bugs were able to get in. They do serve a wonderful breakfast that was included! It was an ok place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: greenbergi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a "package" through Expedia. The main reason why we chose it is because it was one of the cheapest hotels, actually in Venice. Well, the price did not reflect the most fantastic location and atmosphere in this hotel. Admittedly, we did have one of the better rooms (room 2), with a private bathroom, and there was enough room for our 21 month old son's cot, which they also provided. We also did not have to walk up any stais apart from the first few to the reception. The location was just about perfect. Coming in from the airport by bus (for a mere 3 Euros each) this hotel was a short walk from the bus station. It is even closer to the train station and the main Vaporetto stops (Ferrovia). This also means that we did not have to carry your luggage to far. The street it is on is just off a busy high street, so when we turned the corner, we got that immediate sense of relief and quiet, which is quite dramatic, considering how busy the streets are. There was also a fantastic view of the Grand Canal. The staff all spoke good English and were extremely helpful. Breakfast was not that exciting (apart from a good coffee) but sufficient. Any way, turn a corner on the main street and we were faced with numerous food outlets, should had we fancied something more exotic (such as ice cream ad 08.00 am). Just one piece of advice - take insect repellent - after all, Venice is built on canals and has a warm climate - hence mosquitoes. This hotel can be described as basic, but as we were out all day walking, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic saved our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: mbw100
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, really convenient for the station. Agree no lift but the hospitality more than makes up for that! Also helped us out loads when we were pick pocketed. Beware Venice! Especially the Vaparetto stop outside the station. Thanks again Alloggi Agli Artisti!

Reviews.Title: “We need a LIFT!”
Reviews.Author: Alecks
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is good.. Just a few minutes walk from Sta Lucia Station. But, carrying our luggages to 3rd Floor was terrible....I almost fainted going up helping my husband carry our luggages....For everyones information, this hotel doesnt have a LIFT!!!

Reviews.Title: “No lift - pack a light suitcase!”
Reviews.Author: No1Fox
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is very close to the main train station in Venezia, there is no lift/elevator so make sure you pack light and get a room on a lower floor. Breakfast is included and not too bad, but not much variety is on offer. Room size is OK - place to put luggage and hang up clothes. Bathroom is small and shower is even smaller. Hot towel rail was dripping cold water. No place to put anything in bathroom. You cannot use your own hairdryer, because it blows the fuses and you'll have to go to front desk to get instructions on resetting fuses. Their hairdryer is usable, but not wonderful. No English channels on the TV, but we didn't come to watch TV. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Amost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mark&Kaz
Reviews.Content: I returned from Venice 3 months ago but I havn't posted a review about this accomodation as I was unsure what to say regarding my only problem that I had (I will cover this last). The location is absolutly perfect, the staff were very nice, rooms were clean but basic. There is no lift & alot of steps but Venice is a place for walking so this was not a problem for me. My only problem is that both my girlfriend & I were covered in bites that could only have come from the bed, so although I was pleased with the hotel this would probably stop me from returning to this hotel. Shame!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel - would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Villagelife
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - fantastic location just 10 mins walk from the main bus station. Nice clean rooms, lovely breakfast in the morning (complimentary) - and the best coffee! 5 min walk to the nearerst water bus stop (Ferrovia), and recommend taking the #1 down to St Marks square - a beautiful boat trip down the Canel Grande. Would go back at the drop of a hat & stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel, good value and location”
Reviews.Author: eric80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, down a charming calle, and not too hard to find. The main train and waterbus stations are close at hand. The rooms are clean and adequately decorated, however the layout of the hotel and lack of a private bathroom just made it feel a little like a boarding house/dormitory. You also have to leave your key at the reception when leaving the hotel. Breakfast was very basic but adequate. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and in good order and is probably is one of the best value options on the main island.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lulu05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for six nights in March 2007. Our room was with bathroom. We did not have a balcony though. The size of the room was fine in European standards. We have stayed in smaller rooms in other countries. Room was clean, and they changed the sheets and towels daily. The bathroom was actaully quite spacious in our room, but the shower stall was tiny. Water was hot and powerful though. If one was looking for fancy decorations, this was not the place. Breakfast was included. Drinks: juice, coffee, capuccino, hot chocolate and tea. They also had yogurt, cereal, crossiants, and rolls. The quantity was sufficient. The breakfast room was quite small, but the lady serving breakfast was actually quite nice. One day I went down to the room without my husand, and before I put my order on the capuccino, she brought me two cups. Location was excellent. Very close to the train station and vaporetti stops. It was within walking distance (10 mins) to Piazzale Roma, so we did not have to take any transportation to the bus stop. A lot of restaurants and shops in the area. The hotel staff was very nice, and they spoke excellent English. Check in and check out was easy. They had wireless internet connection, but it was 8 euros for 3 hours, or 5 euros for 1 hour. However, there was the mosquito issue. One night, we killed seven mosquitos in the room. We were told, by the hotel reception, that it was a common situation in Venice. They were supposed to have CNN, but once again, according to the staff, due to the satellite problem, we did not have any English-speaking channel for the entire stay, except for the MTV channel. Overall, it was a great value hotel. With the price we paid, can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: margosha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in September 2006. The best feature of this hotel is its location. The location is really convenient if you arrive/leave by the train . I would say it's 100 meters from the train sation. The Ferrovia vaporetti (water bus) station is very close to the hotel as well. The room was nicely decorated. It had a shared balcony and a private bathroom with a shower. The bathroom was really tiny. Its layout was poorly designed, so there was no room for anything. The shower stall wasn't sealed properly, so it leaked really badly during showering. I think the constant leakeage has contributed to a strong moldy smell in the bathroom. There was also a problem with a hairdryer. It didn't have enough power and it blew fuses off after about 30 seconds of use. All of that made hair drying impossible. Well, the good thing, it was +30 outside and I could dry my hair naturally:) I wouldn't recommend booking a room with a shared bathroom. I had a peek at the shared bathroom on our floor, and it was even smaller than the bathroom in our room. The shared bathroom was only good for children and very tiny women. The hotel staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: glenn78
Reviews.Content: A bit concerned with what we would find having read the reviews on this hotel but we were actually very impressed. A fantasic location, yes there's a lot of stairs but it kept us fit!! Rooms were clean and quite a good size apart from bathroom. Would stay there again. Stayed for 1 night on Dec 7th 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Timmylad
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice in 1997 and thought the city was beautiful so i decided to go back in November of this year and stayed at the above mentioned hotel. We booked a room with a bathroom (my fiance is a bit funny about sharing a bathroom, it doesn't bother me) but upon arrival we were told that there was a problem with our room and we were given a key for a bathroom across the corridor. We stayed in room 314 and were very impressed. the bathroom was a good size and the shower was very powerful (and hot). Many people had written about the stairs, and i have to agree if you have any walking difficulties then you really need to request a room on the ground floor. We purchased a 3 day travel ticket that got us from the Airport (Marco polo) Its 25euros if your 30 or over and 19euros if your 29 and under. This is excellent value as you can travel all around the islands and even the main land (Punta Sabbioni). Book this hotel if you are looking for a great place to stay at a very reasonable price. On that note be prepared to pay in Venice. Its quite expensive. But hey i was a tourist so it didn't matter really.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martin_rocks01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 24 Nov â€“ 1st December 2006 and we very happy with our choice. I spent a lot of time researching budget hotels in Venice and trying to find one of the better ones. We definitely did. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and accommodated us for an early check-in. the double room was spacious and the bathroom was clean and modern. The shower was very powerful and the water was always hot. Also having control of the heating via an electronic pad was also very helpful especially during the winter evenings. The security of the building was quite questionable. Anytime you leave the hotel you have to leave your room key at reception. When you ask for your room key back no questions are asked as to who you are. On a number of occasions the front desk person misheard the room number and would give me any old key. It was also very rare to have the same desk person all day and we met 5 different front desk people in 7 nights. The room also has a TV but only has Italian channel s which can be annoying when you are waiting for the missus to finish in the bathroom . the breakfasts were fine. There was a choice of cornflakes, croissants, bread rolls, biscuits and as much orange juice and cappuccino you could drink. The breakfast room was very small and could fill up very quickly. We normally left breakfast until about 9:45am. The poor girl who works in there needs some help to clear tables and serve coffee. All in all we had a great stay and I would definitely recommend this budget hotel to anyone. 420 Euros for 7 nights, you cant be bad to that!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Christina-Lin
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights in December 2005. I had a room without bath but it was alright because the toilets were clean, just that it is at the end of the corridor and the sensor sensitive lights will switch off by itself after some time. It did frightened me a bit, especially in the wee hours. The beds were quite hard but as I could fall asleep anywhere, it wasn't the biggest problem. Besides that, I am really happy with the place. It is quite cheap by Venice standard and the breakfast they served was pretty alright. You tend to wake up smelling croissants from the kitchen. Some of the reception people are really nice and this guy, whom I presumed is the boss, actually let us leave our luggage int he room for a night when we made a day trip to Pisa without charging us! (Though the other staff weren't really convinced when we told them and they insisted on verifying with that guy) The location is pretty good, just a really short walk from the main train station. I would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location economical stay with some problems”
Reviews.Author: yayme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Room 210 of Alloggi Alla Artisti between 12 â€“ 14 October 2006. The hotel was approx 4 minutes walk from the San Lucia Train station and proximate to the Traghetto (water taxi) stop located nearby to the station. The hotel room was located on the 2nd floor (up approx 30 stairs no lift) and had a window which opened out to a small balcony shared with another room. The room was on smallish side (something we discovered about European hotel rooms generally). It opened out onto the street. The room contained a double bed and was equipped with an ensuite comprised of a toilet, bidet, sink, heated towel rail and small shower. It also had a wardrobe chest of drawers and television. The room whilst basic was comfortable and formed a great base for our time in Venice. It was very economical. The receptionist was very kind and spoke very good English. She accommodated an early check in (10.30am) and early check out (5.30am). Our criticisms of the room were as follows: 1.An odour emanated from the floorvent in the ensuite which we noticed upon arrival. We raised this with management who advised us that the rooms were ventilated twice per day which suggested to us that this could be an ongoing problem in some rooms. Unfortunately the hotel was booked out and we could not be moved. We covered the vent with our bathmat and kept the door shut which kept the smell at a very manageable level. 2.Our room was adjacent to the main staircase and the noise of the foot traffic was noticeable from time to time. If readers could secure a room without smell and away from the staircase we recommend the Alloggi Alla Artisti as a good base close to the train station on the island of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Book Here For Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: fotogirl
Reviews.Content: On a short visit to magical Venice in late September I opted to pay more to stay in Old Venice. Having read good reviews of the hotel and it's close location to the Train station & Wifi internet, we reserved in advance. I had emailed and they wrote saying if i booked directly thru their website I could get free wifi. So i booked thru email, and online deposited 15%. The street is easy to overlook and it's right in front of the stairs of the bridge. We knew there was no lift and thankfully were given a room on the 2nd floor. Quite a few steps up upon entering and then 2 flights up. I think we were in Room 114 at the end of the hall. It was a large room with an extra twin bed that looked like a sofa. The lighting was non-existent. The room and bathroom were dark. Hairdryer had no power and the coil cord broke off so we couldn't even use it if we wanted. Spacious shower and bathroom. Like another reviewer I agree the keys were not very secure and it was always a different desk clerk. I had to bring my printout that i booked online so they would give me a wifi code to access however i could never get a strong enough signal and he said i could access internet in my room. I eventually gave up. They do offer to hold luggage on the ground floor down a few steps but again it didn't seem very secure. I'd recommend the twist off locks so you know if your stuff was tampered with. At certain times the breakfast room is very crowded and not large enough to accomodate that many people. People would go and there wouldn't be room to sit so they would leave. Only 1 lady worked it and she clearly needed help. We had to eat without utensils one day! Horrible! By far, the worse part was that I was bit by bed bugs or fleas AND mosquitos in the room. Clearly 2 different kind of bug bites! Overall besides it's convenient location I would definitely NOT stay here again. For the same price I would find another hotel nearby. **A handy tip we accidentally found is that if you don't want to lug your luggage up the many steps to the train station, go along the street to the side (if you're looking at the station, it's the right side) and you can roll your luggage right into the station - no stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend the Agli Artisti”
Reviews.Author: skeelan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in September prior to boarding a cruise ship the following morning. There were 7 of us ranging in age from 78 down to 11 months old, and we had booked 3 double rooms (plus crib) with ensuite bathrooms. Having booked the hotel 14 months in advance, I emailed the hotel a couple of days before our arrival, to confirm our arrival time (and as a safeguard that the hotel still had our booking!) Luckily, I had printed off a copy of the reply, as it took quite some time to locate our booking on arrival at the hotel. Others were not so lucky - we overheard some new arrivals complaining that they had booked two rooms, and only one was available. The receptionist was trying to locate a room in another hotel, but was having little success. He eventually directed them to the train station where there is a tourist information office with details of available accomodation. I don't know how they fared. Administration at this hotel seems a little disorganised - we had further problems trying to check out at 8.30am when a different receptionist again had difficulty in locating our account. Having said that, my various emails had received speedy, pleasant and helpful replies. We knew that there was no elevator, but had planned on leaving all the bags in the lowest level room overnight. In the event, all the rooms were located together at the end of the corridor on the fourth floor. We were offered the option of leaving the bags in the hotel storage room overnight, but declined the offer as the room has no door and is not supervised. The rooms were very clean, quiet and comfortable with A/C and heating, television , ensuite shower room with WC/sink and plentiful supplies of hot water. There was a full bathroom in the hallway outside the rooms. The breakfast room was small - I'd recommend going down 10 minutes before it opens as it fills very quickly. Breakfast comprised bread rolls, croissants, jams, choc spread, cereals, fruit juices, tea and coffee The hotel is very conveniently situated down a narrow alley called Calle Priuli del Cannaletto (?sp) just along from the train station, and very close to Ferrovia waterbus stop and a bridge over the canal. Piazza Romale is within walking distance but there are 2 bridges to cross - not easy with luggage. An easier option is to take the waterbus for one stop All-in-all this 2 star hotel is excellent value for money . Would I stay there again? Yes - provided I had only a small amount of luggage and only after reconfirming booking by email

Reviews.Title: “Nice little room”
Reviews.Author: hunter0008
Reviews.Content: This place was nice. Was close to good shopping and cute little restaurants. Very very very close to the train station. About a block away. (too bad we missed the little street it was on and walked an extra 30minutes with all of our bags). Venice is tricky with their small streets so when you look down the alley and see Hotel Florida, then you're on the right street as this hotel. The A/C was not what I'm used to in the U.S., but that is similar to anywhere in Europe. Not too shabby for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Jism
Reviews.Content: Not a 3 star from US standards. But a very good place to stay. The staff was very helpful and breakfast was good. We liked the room we stayed in. The hotel is a little over 5 min walk from the train station. Definately reccomend this place for price and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and Unsecure”
Reviews.Author: NewName123
Reviews.Content: On a trip where we stayed in 13 different hotels, this one was by far the absolute worst. Had I not prepaid for it I would have left as soon as I soon as I saw the room. Our room was very dank and mold was visible on the curtains. The double bed was literally two twins pushed together and covered with one sheet. There was no box spring underneath to keep the two beds from sliding apart in the night. Several times my husband awoke to find himself dangling between the two beds. The shared bathroom was filthy. We were very uncomfortable using it. The doors were locked with skeleton keys making them easy to break into. The keys are all stored at the front desk in plain sight of anyone in the lobby. If you wanted to rob someone all you would have to do is walk into the hotel, see what keys were available and ask for one. They will give it to you without checking to see that you actually belong in the room. Especially disturbing is the fact that after a 3 day stay I never once saw the same desk clerk. There would be no possibility of them knowing who belonged there on sight alone. To the hotel's credit it is very close to the train station and easy walking distance to the major sites and vaparetto stop. I would highly recommend you stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Peeya
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to Santa Lucia train station. Staff is friendly and helpful. It was bit noisy at night because the room was facing the road. Overall it is a nice place to stay. Top most rooms might have the canal view but no elevators so have to carry bags all the way to the fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Venice on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mischrisy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for only 1 night and it was good value. It was easliy accessible - after hearing all the stories of people getting lost, and the amount of theft on the island - and right near the train station of Santa Lucia. Although it's a bit of a walk from Piazzale Roma (when you arrive by bus or from the airport) as you have to cross Ponte Scalzi...not great for suitcases!! Cannareggio is a great area - not so expensive and great restaurants in the area. We paid 110 euro for a triple on a Saturday night in June. Breakfast, private bathroom and air-con was included in the price. Staff were friendly and I would definitely stay there again, its great for budget travellers. If you book on their website its a little more expensive I found it even cheaper (by about 30 euro) on to Book.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelsLiz
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in general. The price was lower than most hotels we looked at in the area. It was a 2 minute walk from the train station and was less than a minute walk to one of the three bridges crossing the grand canal. The room had a bathroom and was well worth it to have one to ourselves. The beds weren't the most comfortable but after long days walking around we couldn't really tell a difference. The rooms were well air-conditioned and very comfortable in general. Each room has a Klimt painting over the bed and outside the room which gave it a nice touch. The staff were mostly friendly and held our luggage for free after we checked out while we walked around the city. The free breakfast was nice and included fresh croissants, cereal, and juices. Overall - a great buy in a pretty good location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonbaby82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Agli Artisti Hotel for my birthday. I was so suprised when I got there it was VERY clean, the staff were prompt courtious and very helpful. They even gave us a little map with most tourist spots marked, the water bus stops and the hotel marked on the map. They were one of the few hotels that offered a free breakfast. We had fresh sheets and clean towels every morning. We had AC in our room which we had complete control over we left it running 24/7. The staff were very helpful anytime wed ask for directions or even for bookings they would call and make them for us. We had a shared bathroom, never had any problems or had to wait to shower or use the bathroom. the rooms are all very spread out so it was quite. the bed was surprisingly comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice. This hotel is a great value for your money.. The hotel is in a good location about a 2 minute walk from the train station and water bus station. Lots of shops and restaraunts in the area as well

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price!”
Reviews.Author: shrewdfool
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would recommend the Alloggi Agli Artisti if you visit Venice. The hotel itself was decent. But keep in mind (when you read the other reviews) that you need to compare it to other hotels in Venice, which are also renovated old buildings as well. Obviously going into an "retro" city like Venice, you cannot expect a hotel to have state of the art Western amenities, or a Olympic sized pool with waterslides. I would say it was above average. I stayed in a double room, with private bathroom. The bathroom was kinda small. The bed was pretty much two twin beds put together (which I encountered a few times in this trip to Italy). And yes, there is no elevator, so if you have a high floor, you will have to "rough it" a little up and down the steps. The two main factors that put this hotel over the top into "Recommend" status is 1) Location and 2) Price. First, the price. It was fairly cheaper than many other hotels I had researched in Venice. Were they better? I don't really know, but this one was a good value. Especially the hotels located in Venice itself and near San Marco Square, the prices were outlandishly high......which leads to my second attribute.... .....the location. There is (in my opinion, of course) absolutely no need to break the wallet for a hotel in the touristy areas of Venice. I can't emphasize this point enough. The Alloggi Agli Artisti is located in the Cannaregio area, which is north of (the main part of) Venice. It is literally about a two minute and 45 second walk from the train station and a two minute and 50 second walk from the Waterbus stop of Line 1 and 82. This is fantastic. No need to lug your bags onto the crowded waterbuses. In fact, this is a mere 8 minute ride to the Rialto Bridge, where you can get off and walk to San Marco square in about 12 minutes. Venice is pretty small and very manageable to survey on foot (although I'd still recommend the waterbuses to get about to save time and strength for long journeys). But the location was what sold me on this. So take my review as you may. Perhaps it may be taken more as a recommendation for the hotels in the Cannaregio region in general, of which there are many of that I walked passed. The main street there has a lot of people outside into the late hours, so it is very safe, although the Alloggi Agli Artisti itself is not on this street but on a really really tiny and quiet street (some from big cities like me, may call it an alley), but there are other hotels and restaurants on the street as well; and again many of Venice's streets are like this, veritable cracks between two buildings. But either way, whether this hotel or one of it's neighbors, I'd highly recommend this area and I would recommend Alloggi Agli Artisti too. It had its good points and drawbacks, but in the end it did not disappoint. And it would certainly be a consideration as a place to stay if I were to arrive in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood vibe with good train station locale...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
