Reviews.Content: Venice was great and this is a perfect hotel pick. Once you get over the fact that there is no elevator, the hotel is in a great location for travels by train or by vaporetto. My boyfriend and I traveled to Florence by train and came back to stay at this quaint hotel. It was nice to soak in the Venetian feel sitting on the balcony with a Venetian Spritz in hand while the neighbors listened to Italian opera across the way. If you are looking for a more rustic hotel setting, this is the place. I would not agree with most of the reviews regarding cleanliness, I did my fair share of cleaning once I entered the room we were given, a good dusting was definitely needed. Aside from that, no problems, nice people at the front desk and the breakfast consisted of croissants, coffee and cereal. Trying to find an egg in this town for breakfast can be difficult but we found some places with tramanzinis of egg and salmon or egg and ham while checking out the sites. Take a trip over to Murano while you are there and stop by the supermarket "COOP" and pick up some local stuff you might want to bring home. It is a whole lot cheaper then buying it in the specialty tourist shops in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault much with this hotel. It's in a good location, close to the number 1 ferry stop as well as the train station. The rooms are basic but very clean and breakfast was a choice of fresh croissants, cereal, breads and coffees. The staff were also very helpful and polite. The only thing to be aware of is that there's no lift however there are only 4 floors in the hotel so its only a short struggle if you end up on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel! Left and found another one...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel online after the photos of the place looked great. The man who helped us check in was very kind and helpful -- However, after we lugged our suitcases up to the third floor, we walked into our room and were terribly disappointed. The room was so small, there wasn't even a space to open up our suitcases except on the bed. We had booked a room with a shared bathroom, but the handle on the shared bathroom was pulling out of the wall when we opened it. The place was dirty and had a dank atmosphere. We walked down the street and found a different hotel and immediately canceled our reservation at Alloggi without staying there. We definitely would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet calle about five minutes walk from the train station or ten minutes walk from the bus station. We stayed in a double room on the 3rd floor and although the room had no bathroom, the facilities were only a few steps down the corridor. The room was spacious with air conditioning, tv and a balcony. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. The breakfasts were also really good consisting of different fresh juices, cereal and milk, yoghurts, croissants, jams, breadrolls and any kind of hot drinks. Nearby the hotel are a selection of really good restaurants, of which the best is the Il Sandolo. Overall we can recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a middle class couple in our mid twenties, and this was our first time in venice. We paid $146.55 CAD/night through expedia and stayed for 3 days. The hotel was practically around the corner from the train station and was in a very quiet location. The staff where great, and helped us with places to eat, things to see, etc. They even called the train station when we thought they were on strike (but wasn't, it was only the metro). We were on the 2nd floor, as there wasn't an elevator we had to carry our bags, but doing that 2 times in the 3 days we stayed wasn't so bad. The room was spotless, and was nicely decorated. The only problem was that the sink started leaking, and the sewer system released some fumes sometimes (my boyfriend who is an engineer said that the pipes that were installed a long time ago didn't include a seperate pipe that would vent out the fumes, so he assumed all venice was like this as the city is quite old). They forgot towels once, but quickly brought them to use when we called. We informed the concierge about the leak and they had someone fix it before we came back to the hotel. Overall a great hotel for a great price.

HotelInfo.Name: Alloggi Agli Artisti
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Priuli Cavalletti 99-A/B | Cannaregio, 30121 Venice, Italy
